description: Extracts rich structured data from conceptual_framework_extraction engine output (~16k words, 3 passes). Produces 7 accordion sections: frameworks with components/vocabulary/methodological signatures, vocabulary map, metaphor inventory, cross-domain transfers, framework relationships, and architectural summary.

frameworks.name: string (framework name)
frameworks.type: string (e.g. economic, philosophical, sociological, political, methodological, interdisciplinary)
frameworks.description: string (2-4 sentences describing the framework and its role)
vocabulary: string (distinctive terms introduced by this framework)
frameworks.methodological_signature: string (how this framework shapes the method of inquiry)
frameworks.relationship_to_argument: string (how this framework serves the author's overall argument)

vocabulary_map.framework_origin: string (which framework introduces or owns this term)
vocabulary_map.definition: string (how the author defines or uses this term)
vocabulary_map.semantic_weight: enum: heavy|medium|light (how central this term is)
related_terms: string (terms in the same semantic field)

evidence_types_privileged: string (what counts as evidence for this method)

metaphor_inventory.function: string (what analytical work the metaphor does)

cross_domain_transfers.concept_transferred: string (what concept or method is transferred)
cross_domain_transfers.transformation: string (how the concept changes in transfer)

llm_extraction_schema.architectural_summary: string (3-5 paragraphs synthesizing the overall conceptual architecture: how frameworks combine, where tensions emerge, what the architecture enables and constrains)

llm_prompt_template:
You are a precise data extraction assistant specializing in philosophical and intellectual analysis. Extract structured JSON from analytical prose about a target work's conceptual frameworks.

The input contains output from the conceptual_framework_extraction engine across multiple passes, analyzing the target work's frameworks, vocabulary, and methodology.

Return a JSON object with this EXACT structure:

{
  "frameworks": [
    {
      "name": "<framework name>",
      "type": "<economic|philosophical|sociological|political|methodological|interdisciplinary>",
      "description": "<2-4 sentences describing the framework>",
      "components": ["<key components>"],
      "vocabulary": ["<distinctive terms>"],
      "methodological_signature": "<how this framework shapes inquiry>",
      "relationship_to_argument": "<how it serves the overall argument>"
    }
  ],
  "vocabulary_map": [
    {
      "term": "<the term>",
      "framework_origin": "<which framework>",
      "definition": "<how the author uses it>",
      "semantic_weight": "<heavy|medium|light>",
      "related_terms": ["<related terms>"]
    }
  ],
  "methodological_signatures": [
    {
      "framework": "<framework name>",
      "method": "<the method>",
      "distinguishing_features": "<what makes it distinctive>",
      "evidence_types_privileged": ["<evidence types>"]
    }
  ],
  "metaphor_inventory": [
    {
      "metaphor": "<the metaphor>",
      "source_domain": "<source>",
      "target_domain": "<target>",
      "function": "<analytical work it does>",
      "frequency": "<pervasive|recurring|occasional>"
    }
  ],
  "cross_domain_transfers": [
    {
      "from_domain": "<source field>",
      "to_domain": "<target field>",
      "concept_transferred": "<what transfers>",
      "transformation": "<how it changes>",
      "success": "<productive|partial|strained>"
    }
  ],
  "framework_relationships": [
    {
      "framework_a": "<name>",
      "framework_b": "<name>",
      "relationship": "<complementary|tension|subordination|synthesis|competition>",
      "description": "<how they interact>"
    }
  ],
  "architectural_summary": "<3-5 paragraphs synthesizing the overall conceptual architecture>"
}

RULES:
1. Return ONLY JSON — no markdown fences, no commentary
2. Extract 8-15 frameworks (be thorough — the source material is rich)
3. Vocabulary map: 15-30 entries covering the most analytically significant terms
4. Metaphor inventory: 5-15 metaphors, focusing on those that do real analytical work
5. Cross-domain transfers: 3-10 entries where concepts move between disciplines
6. Framework relationships: map tensions and complementarities between ALL major frameworks
7. The architectural_summary should be a genuine synthesis, not a list — show how the pieces fit together
8. Preserve the original terminology and phrasing faithfully
9. Multiple passes of analysis are provided — synthesize across ALL passes, not just the last one
source: Created for genealogy_tp_conceptual_framework view — per-engine rich extraction
